title: Trump’s Search for Powell’s Replacement Adds to Cacophony Around Interest Rate Decision
summary: The end of Jerome Powell’s term as Fed chair will give President Trump his biggest opportunity yet to reshape the central bank.

title: Republicans Are Fighting With One Another in Deep-Red Indiana. Here’s Why.
summary: Some Republicans in the Indiana Senate have resisted a new congressional map despite lobbying from the White House and threats of political consequences.

title: Democrats Make a Fresh Push to Win State Legislatures
summary: The arm of the party that focuses on statehouses is targeting hundreds of seats and more than 40 chambers, according to a strategy memo, reflecting Democrats’ new optimism.

title: Democrats Press to Expand House Map, Targeting 5 New G.O.P. Seats
summary: Four of the additions are for districts where President Trump won handily, but Democrats are feeling emboldened by election outcomes this fall.

title: Inside the Pentagon’s Scramble to Deal With Boat Strike Survivors
summary: Officials initially weighed sending survivors of U.S. attacks on boats suspected of drug smuggling to a notorious prison in El Salvador, to keep them away from American courts.

title: A History of U.S. Military Action in Latin America
summary: The United States’ history in the region includes several about-faces, contradictions and missteps.

title: Venezuela’s Nobel Peace Prize Winner Says She Will Appear in Oslo After Missing Ceremony
summary: María Corina Machado, the Venezuelan opposition leader, said she was on her way to Norway after living in hiding in her country, where officials have threatened her with arrest.

title: Trump Administration Rules Threaten Nobel Prizes Won by Immigrants
summary: As three immigrants claim Nobel Prizes in science for the United States this year, experts warn that immigration crackdowns could undo American innovation.

title: Judi Jupiter, a 76-Year-Old Social Media Star, Is Gen Z at Heart
summary: In the 1970s, she photographed Andy Warhol and Debbie Harry on wild nights at Studio 54. Now she’s chronicling a new generation.

title: Judge Grants Request to Unseal Jeffrey Epstein Grand Jury Records
summary: The ruling could lead to the most expansive look yet at the federal investigation of the convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Netflix and Paramount Battle for Warner Bros. — Have We Seen This Show Before?
summary: The tug of war for Warner Bros. Discovery echoes an earlier clash of media titans.

title: Trump’s Interest in Warner Bros. Deal Weighs On Justice Department
summary: President Trump’s unusual decision to involve himself in the government’s review of the deal puts his antitrust chief in an awkward position.

title: Tony Dokoupil Is Named Anchor of ‘CBS Evening News’
summary: He replaces John Dickerson and Maurice DuBois in one of the most high-profile decisions of Bari Weiss’s early tenure as the network’s editor in chief.

title: The Conservative Overhaul of the University of Texas Is Underway
summary: The school has been brought to heel by conservative critics of higher education. It is part of a broader transformation at the state’s universities.

title: The Challenges to Europe’s Security Go Beyond Trump’s Lack of Support
summary: Europeans find themselves stranded between hostile powers, Russia and the United States, with key decisions looming over the future of Ukraine.

title: This Arkansas City Shows How to Slash Emissions and Save Money, Too
summary: In the Ozarks, the growing college town of Fayetteville, Ark., is using clean energy to power city facilities and embracing nature-based solutions to climate threats.

title: 16 Best Theater Moments of 2025
summary: Lea Michele’s star turn in “Chess.” Kara Young as an 8-year-old. A 12-minute monologue delivered from a cloud. These are our favorite scenes from this year.

title: Sophie Kinsella, ‘Confessions of a Shopaholic’ Author, Dies at 55
summary: Writing under a pseudonym, Madeleine Wickham cultivated an international following for her series centered on a young woman addicted to shopping.

title: She Was Diagnosed With Brain Cancer, Then Wrote a Rom-Com About It
summary: Sophie Kinsella, the author of “Confessions of a Shopaholic,” packs love, laughter and a harrowing real-life health ordeal into a 133-page novella.

title: M. Gessen and Michelle Goldberg on How to Resist
summary: Through their reporting, the columnists share how regular citizens stand up to governments they oppose.

title: 50 States, 50 Fixes
summary: We look at climate solutions across the country.

title: Does the Job of C.E.O. or Private Investor Come First? Intel’s Chief Is Juggling That Question.
summary: Lip-Bu Tan, who was appointed chief executive of Intel in March, is also a longtime venture capitalist. His dual roles have caused some consternation.

title: A New Governor Inherits a Misconduct Investigation Into the State Police
summary: A prolonged slowdown in traffic enforcement by New Jersey troopers coincided with an uptick in fatal crashes. The pattern remains under investigation as Mikie Sherrill prepares to take office.

title: Meta’s New A.I. Superstars Are Chafing Against the Rest of the Company
summary: An us-versus-them mentality has emerged between Meta’s top artificial intelligence team and longtime lieutenants to Mark Zuckerberg.

title: A Cinnabon Worker Was Fired for a Racist Slur. Her Supporters Have Raised $130,000.
summary: On a video that went viral, the worker, who is white, can be seen calling two Black customers an epithet. The campaign to give her money echoes the reaction to a similar incident this year.
